result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Russell J. Mann #00333304

defendant.name: Mann #00333304, Russell J.
defendant.address: c/o Stanley Correctional Institution, 100 Corrections Drive, Stanley, WI 54768

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waive reading of the information.  Defense entered NGP.  Court entered NGP on the defendant's behalf.  Set for PTC 11/9.

9:52 AM Defendant Russell J. Mann in court in custody.  Attorney David Pierce Jr. in court for Russell J. Mann.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin. State calls witness J.W. Detective for Jackson County Sheriff's Office, sworn; testifies. Working for JASO on 2/4/22.  Record reflects identification of defendant. Testifies to contact w/defendant and taken into custody. Viewed baggie of drugs, pipe, safe under bed. Obtained a search warrant. Testified to what found. Weighed gem bag .4 grams, tested positive for meth. Spoke w/defendant who denied the drugs were his. Cross examination by Attorney Pierce. Testified to other individuals in home. No Redirect. No other witnesses. Probable cause found. Defendant requests substitution. Court finds timely request for substitution. Waives reading, enter NG plea. PTC date set for 11/9.

9:50 AM Defendant Russell J. Mann appeared by video, in custody of Stanley Correctional.  Attorney David Pierce Jr. appeared by video for Russell J. Mann.  Attorney Crystal Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant agrees to appear remotely. Waive reading of the complaint.  Set for Preliminary Hearing defendant in person. 30 min hearing. Attorney Pierce to contact JA to schedule.
Order to Produce Prisoner to Appear for Court Proceedings
